semantic_title: Sepsis and Septic Shock Complicating Abortion, Pregnancy, Childbirth and Puerperium
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 15. Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperium > j. Sepsis and septic shock complicating abortion, pregnancy, childbirth and the puerperium

content.full_text: When assigning a chapter 15 code for sepsis complicating abortion, pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium, a code for the specific type of infection should be assigned as an additional diagnosis. If severe sepsis is present, a code from subcategory R65.2, Severe sepsis, and code(s) for associated organ dysfunction(s) should also be assigned as additional diagnoses. (Evidence: pg no: 67, L41-L42)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding sepsis complications in obstetric patients requiring additional infection and severity codes (Evidence: pg no: 67, L41-L42)
key_concepts: Chapter 15 sepsis codes require additional infection codes (Evidence: pg no: 67, L41-L42)
Severe sepsis requires R65.2 coding (Evidence: pg no: 67, L42)
Organ dysfunction codes needed for severe sepsis (Evidence: pg no: 67, L42)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Code for specific type of infection should be assigned as additional diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 67, L41-L42)
detailed_rules.explanation: When using Chapter 15 sepsis codes, the causative organism or infection type must be coded separately (Evidence: pg no: 67, L41-L42)

detailed_rules.rule_text: If severe sepsis is present, assign R65.2 and organ dysfunction codes (Evidence: pg no: 67, L42)
detailed_rules.explanation: Severe sepsis in obstetric patients requires additional coding for severity and associated organ dysfunction (Evidence: pg no: 67, L42)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Assign appropriate Chapter 15 sepsis code
Step 2: Add code for specific infection type
Step 3: If severe sepsis, add R65.2
Step 4: Add organ dysfunction codes if applicable

code_ranges.description: Severe sepsis subcategory (Evidence: pg no: 67, L42)
usage_rules: Use with organ dysfunction codes (Evidence: pg no: 67, L42)
